DOC.brief_title: Micro-nutritional Status Gut Microbiota Morbidly Obese Patients Before After Gastric Bypass
DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim study analyse micro-nutritional status morbidly obese patient 6 month bariatric surgery ( Roux-en-Y gastric bypass , RYGB ) . The secondary outcome impact 6 month probiotic , mineral , aminoacids , omega-3 acid vitamin supplementation microbiota , metabolic psychological parameter 12 month post-RYGB . An intervention study 90 obese patient ( BMI > 40 kg/m2 ) use . Nutritional , metabolic psychological status well gut microbiota evaluate gastric bypass 6 month post RYGB . During period 6 month , patient receive specific diet accord recommendation regard RYGB . Subjects randomize 2 sub-groups : A. patient receive standard healthy diet without micro-nutriments ' supplementation ; B. patient receive healthy diet probiotic , mineral , aminoacids , omega-3 acid vitamin mineral supplementation Healthy diet define follow : 9-15 % protein , 50-55 % carbohydrates 30-35 % lipid ( 25 % saturate fat , 50 % mono-unsaturated fat 25 % poly-unsaturated fat ) . The following parameter analyse RYGB 6 month 12 month post RYGB , respectively : - Nutritional status oxidative stress parameter ( Vitamins A E , Selenium , Zinc , Copper , Glutathione peroxidise , Superoxide dismutase Iron ) - Metabolic parameter ( Total cholesterol , LDL-cholesterol , HDL-cholesterol , Triglycerides , fast glucose insulin , CRP ) - Fatty acid ( linoleic acid , alpha-linoleic acid ( ALA ) , eicosapentaenoic acid ( EPA ) , docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) - Gut microbiota - Psychological status ( anxiety , depression quality life evaluate validated questionnaire ) .
